entries.name: OpenSSL::OCSP::BasicResponse.new(der_string = nil) → basic_responseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Creates a new BasicResponse. If der_string is given, decodes der_string as DER.

entries.name: add_nonce(nonce = nil)click to toggle source
entries.desc: Adds nonce to this response.  If no nonce was provided a random nonce will be added.

entries.name: add_status(certificate_id, status, reason, revocation_time, this_update, next_update, extensions) → basic_responseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Adds a certificate status for certificate_id. status is the status, and must be one of these:

entries.name: copy_nonce(request) → Integerclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Copies the nonce from request into this response.  Returns 1 on success and 0 on failure.

entries.name: find_response(certificate_id) → SingleResponse | nilclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns a SingleResponse whose CertId matches with certificate_id, or nil if this BasicResponse does not contain it.

entries.name: responses → Array of SingleResponseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an Array of SingleResponse for this BasicResponse.

entries.name: sign(cert, key, certs = nil, flags = 0, digest = nil) → selfclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Signs this OCSP response using the cert, key and optional digest. This behaves in the similar way as OpenSSL::OCSP::Request#sign.

entries.name: status → statusesclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Returns an Array of statuses for this response.  Each status contains a CertificateId, the status (0 for good, 1 for revoked, 2 for unknown), the reason for the status, the revocation time, the time of this update, the time for the next update and a list of OpenSSL::X509::Extension.

entries.name: to_der → Stringclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Encodes this basic response into a DER-encoded string.

entries.name: verify(certificates, store, flags = 0) → true or falseclick to toggle source
entries.desc: Verifies the signature of the response using the given certificates and store. This works in the similar way as OpenSSL::OCSP::Request#verify.
